meanings.definition: The quality or state of being subject to chance or random variation.
meanings.sent1: The chanciness of the weather made planning a picnic difficult.
meanings.sent2: She won the game due to the chanciness of picking the right card.
meanings.sent3: The chanciness of finding a four-leaf clover amused the children.
meanings.sent4: The chanciness of life's twists and turns can be both exciting and nerve-wracking.
meanings.sent5: The chanciness of the coin flip determined the winner of the bet.

meanings.definition: The likelihood of something happening by chance.
meanings.sent1: The chanciness of winning the lottery is very low.
meanings.sent2: He relied on the chanciness of meeting his old friend in the crowded city.
meanings.sent3: The chanciness of the cat catching the mouse provided some entertainment.
meanings.sent4: The chanciness of the thunderstorm hitting during the outdoor event was surprisingly high.
meanings.sent5: The chanciness of finding a parking spot during rush hour seemed impossible.
